The Four of Cups shows a man far from the others, contemplating something. There are a few symbolic elements in the card, such as cups in front of him, as well as another cup being offered. It could be a challenging card to interpret because there’s nothing too obvious about it.

Many interpretations derive from human nature, the fact that we often take things for granted, especially when we have them. We find it difficult to see what the world has in store for us, so we usually focus on things we don’t have.
All in all, let’s see what all these things mean for your love, career, and health.
Meaning of Upright Four of Cups

The Four of Cups is often associated with a lack of motivation. People feel like they can’t get out of a bad loop. They’re discouraged to keep trying because they can’t get anywhere. Life stagnates, and no matter how hard they try, they fail to find passion again.

The Four of Cups is not a bad card, though. It’s not here to show you how bad you’re doing. Instead, it aims to take you out of this black hole. It calls for a deep evaluation of your attitude and overall life experience. Many times, the solution is right there, you just can’t see it.

The card won’t tell you what to change, but it will push you to find your motives to regain your passion. At the end of the day, it’s your own responsibility to ditch monotony and find some meaning in your life.
Upright Four of Cups in Love & Relationships

Indifference is probably the best word to describe the upright Four of Cups in a love reading, yet some could also refer to boredom. It’s not something good, indeed, but it’s natural, especially after a conflict or maybe a breakup.

However, if you see this card, you must make sure you’re not just bored in an actual relationship, mainly while trying to look after yourself. Sure, weariness occurs at times. But even if excitement seems to be gone, you need to explore and experiment some more.
That’s for both you and your partner.
When you’re single, keep in mind that opportunities only come if you try to see them.
Upright Four of Cups in Career

In reading about your career, the upright Four of Cups tells you that you’re distracted and obviously underperforming. Focusing on tasks seems impossible. Even if there are some new projects at work, you just can’t find excitement about them.
Your mood will clearly suffer from this lack of excitement, too.
In the long run, your productivity will lower. Throw in the overall feeling of a stagnating career and it feels like you’re trapped in a job with no future.

Stagnation is often the main issue and that’s how it all starts. Maybe you need to determine what makes you so unhappy about your career and work on these problems. Or perhaps you have to find your passion once again. Think about it, why was this career so exciting before?
Upright Four of Cups in Money
The same distraction can also affect you financially. You can’t enjoy what you have because you’re too busy focusing on others. You’re more concerned about what others are doing rather than yourself.
The best thing to do is stop comparing yourself with others. This envy will stop you from enjoying life.

What works in this situation is being more grateful. Look at how you can improve your finances, and feel free to take small risks every now and then. If you’re so focused on things you don’t have, you’ll fail to enjoy what you have.
However, based on other cards in the spread, the upright Four of Cups could also show disillusionment with your finances.
Upright Four of Cups in Health

In a health reading, the upright Four of Cups does indicate some distress and potential health problems, most of them relating to depression. Your health isn’t great, and you know it, meaning it will make you feel a bit disappointed with yourself.
On the same principle, stop focusing on what you can’t do and do things you love instead.

Furthermore, it’s alright to seek help, whether from professionals or perhaps your family and friends. The trick here is to be able to maintain a positive attitude. Many times, talking about problems could make life a lot easier.
The upright Four of Cups is never really associated with a pregnancy, so it shouldn’t affect your desire to conceive at this point. But then, depression and boredom could.

If you get this card while asking how someone feels about you, the respective person is indifferent. They don’t really care about what’s going on. Moreover, they don’t tend to share their feelings, even if they’re in pain.

Intentions don’t exist at all because that person is reserved. Withdrawing from real life seems to be the only way to avoid problems. Sure, they know they could lose your connection if they keep doing that, but they’re also bored with this relationship.

They see you in the exact same manner. They think you have no motivation, hence the boredom. They know you take many things for granted, hence your stagnation, so their overall opinion of you isn’t great.
When it comes to actions, don’t make any rushed decisions. You need time to think about everything. The upright Four of Cups tells you that you have to sort a few problems before moving on.
Meaning of Reversed Four of Cups

In a reversed position, the Four of Cups isn’t much different. Apathy is part of your life, meaning you’ll inevitably miss a lot of opportunities. You do, however, have the will to start all over and that’s a good thing.

The card shows that you’ve been well disconnected in the past, but you’re finally starting to see how beautiful life can be. You now understand that nothing in life is perfect, yet there’s beauty in pretty much everything.
Observing this beauty will naturally bring joy.
Feel free to open yourself up to new people, locations, ideas, and adventures.
Reversed Four of Cups in Love & Relationships

When you see this card, you know things are about to change. You’ve been contemplating for too long, so it’s now time to move on. You’re about to get more involved with your romantic life, so you can have more opportunities.
If you’re coming after a breakup, you’ll understand that you can’t change the past. You’re now ready to build a better future.
It’s perfectly normal to feel excited because it feels like life is only just starting now.
If you’re already in a relationship, you’ll rediscover your partner through experimentation and adventure.
Reversed Four of Cups in Career
Your stagnation is over. Work has been a nightmare lately, but things are changing now. The reason is irrelevant, as long as the fog is gone.
You may notice you’re more creative at work. From this point of view, you’ll be more productive and motivated, now that you can see some results.
New realizations push you to grow, change, and adapt. If that’s been the issue so far, a change will put you back on track.

Keep in mind that you’ll still have to discover and work with this new energy. Nothing will improve overnight, unless you get involved. However, on a more positive note, lost or ignored opportunities are suddenly more appealing.
Reversed Four of Cups in Money

For your finances, this could mean that you’re more secure. Your economic struggle is over and you can make better decisions. Sure, you might’ve made some changes, but it’s not over. Your efforts should still be there.

Even if you’ve learned something from your previous mistakes, the universe will give you rewards based on your energy only. Forget about distractions or what others think of it, just save or spend based on what makes you happy.
Reversed Four of Cups in Health

When it comes to your health, the reversed Four of Cups is about positivity. Your energy is back, and you’re ready to tackle your problems. It makes no difference what kept you down, you’re radiating good vibes at the moment.
The card usually shows those who have left their health problems, which affect how they see life. When it pops up, it means you’re ready to move on.
If you haven’t been motivated enough to conceive, this could be a good time. But once again, the Four of Cups is not really associated with a pregnancy.
If you’re curious about someone’s feelings, the reversed Four of Cups means they’re ready to let go of the past. They’re ready to move on and find excitement and enthusiasm again.
The respective person also feels more open and can take a chance. They want to end the withdrawal phase, so they’ll start looking up to you.
They see you with good eyes because you’re clearly the more positive person in this connection, so they’ll try to follow you.

In terms of action, just put yourself out there and do something. Ask your crush out, start that new project at work, go to the gym, whatever it is; this is the perfect time to break the shell and do it.
Numerological Meaning of Four of Cups
The Four of Cups in any position is associated with the number 4. This is often about a generous approach to life.
In classic numerology, the interpretation can be different.
The number 4 is also associated with a square. There are four elements or four sides. This means the number could relate to leadership and energy.
Astrological Meaning of Four of Cups

The number four goes into astrology, too, so it’s sometimes related to Jupiter. But from a more traditional point of view, the four sides are attributed to Saturn. Jupiter is more generous by nature, while Uranus has great instincts.
The four sides may also relate to the earth.
Zodiac Correspondence of the Four of Cups

It’s not hard to make a zodiac connection with the Four of Cups. Its interpretations are very similar to Cancer. People in this zodiac sign have an introspective profile. Their emotions run high, but they’re not always open about them.
Self-absorption is part of the game, and in the long run, nostalgic feelings may ravage their hearts.
Yes or No Meaning for the Four of Cups

It’s nearly impossible to interpret the Four of Cups in an upright position as a yes or no recommendation. It’s slightly negative due to the lack of enthusiasm, so it’s usually associated with no. But it’s also a piece of advice, as you need to look inward to solve these issues.

In the reversed position, it’s more positive and tells you that things are getting better. Therefore, it’s a yes card, but it requires work and caution. It won’t solve problems by itself, but it tells you that you’re ready to do something about your stagnation.
Key Actions

Whether in an upright or reversed position, the Four of Cups is a card of encouragement. Different positions indicate different stages in your life based on your mindset and how you feel. However, the message is the same.
No matter what happens, you must take action. Feeling bored? Depressed? Sad? Take action and change something about these issues if you want to improve your life.

Feeling like you’re ready to explode with enthusiasm and energy? Nothing will change unless you do something about it. Therefore, you still have to take some action in order to change your current state.

Bottom line, the Four of Cups may look negative, but it’s an encouraging card that could help you get out of a bad state. It inspires you to find happiness in the present moment, appreciate the good things around you, and start on a path of positive self-transformation.

There are certain tarot cards out there that no one really wants to see. That’s because the moment you see them, you can tell they’re associated with a negative experience. Unfortunately, the Five of Cups is one of these cards.

The card is associated with loss, pain, challenges, and negativity. It shows a figure with a black cloak, hiding their face. There are five cups in the card, too, each with its own significance. Throwing in the river in the background is not just a negative card but also a confusing one.
All in all, let’s go through every interpretation of the Five of Cups and see what it actually means for your life.
Meaning of Upright Five of Cups
The Five of Cups is very often associated with disappointment and all kinds of negative feelings triggered when things go the wrong way.

The idea is to move forward with a different plan when something unexpected happens. Unfortunately, many people choose to contemplate it. They dwell in the past and just can’t let regret go. That’s the primary message of the Five of Cups.
The water spilled from cups also relates to missed opportunities, which could be just as dramatic.

The card isn’t there to tell you how hard life is. Instead, it tells you that you cling to the past and you’re not willing to move on. Besides, you don’t seem to learn from the past either. What this means is the possibility to miss on numerous opportunities and joys.
Upright Five of Cups in Love & Relationships
In love and relationships, the upright Five of Cups is about sadness and mourning. You may have reasons to do it, indeed, especially if you’ve been through a big conflict or a breakup.

You do need to understand that it’s not the end of the world. While it does show emotional loss, you can also learn to focus on things that are still there. This could be the one element needed to regain your hope.
No matter how many reasons you have to be upset, the card tells you that there is a bit of positivity out there. You just have to see it, embrace it, and let it help.
Upright Five of Cups in Career
For your career, the loss has a more professional nature. Maybe you’ve lost a job or perhaps a partnership. Perhaps you’ve missed a project or a great opportunity to be promoted.
It could also mean that you’re demoted, so you’re going backwards. There are lots of different aspects that could relate, so the interpretation depends on your unique circumstances.

Again, there could be a period of unhappiness, as such changes are always difficult. But they also offer an opportunity. You’re supposed to learn from it. Plus, there’s always something to salvage, regardless of how dark the situation is.
Upright Five of Cups in Money

An issue with resources is almost always the case if you draw the Five of Cups in an upright position. It won’t be easy. It could be associated with stress or other issues, but most importantly, you can’t let it aggravate.
You need to start rebuilding your financial security as soon as you notice a problem. Stop spending, avoid unnecessary outings, and so on.
Like always, no matter how dark it seems, this card always tries to tell you that there’s a solution out there. However, it may not be too easy to find.
Upright Five of Cups in Health

For your health, the upright Five of Cups shows emotional issues. It could go in more directions. It could be something temporary, but it could also be a mental health problem. The reasons behind it are more diversified. Money, career, love, you name it.
The card shows sadness and various problems associated with it, such as depression, anxiety, or even panic attacks. It sounds like a terrible spiral, but your duty is to try to get out of it.
Don’t go crazy on it because it won’t work. Start with baby steps. Have a coffee with a family member or your best friend. Before you know it, you’ll be back on track.
If the situation seems too severe, it might be wiser to seek professional help.
The Five of Cups in a health reading is mainly related to emotional and mental problems rather than physical issues.

If you’re trying to conceive, the interpretation is pretty much similar. Maybe your previous pregnancy failed. Maybe you’ve been trying for ages, unsuccessfully. It feels like a mission impossible, but the card tells you that there’s a way.

If you ask how someone feels about you, the card shows sadness. The respective person doesn’t feel very well, especially after a loss. The pain is there, and it’s so deep that there’s not much you can do about it.
That person finds it hard to find something positive in life. Perhaps you could help.

Their intentions aren’t too positive. They tend to ignore all the good things around them but only focus on the negatives. They believe they’re not good enough, so despite all the opportunities around them, they choose to ignore everything.

Even if you ask how someone feels about you, the answer will go in the same direction. You’re seen as someone who carries a heavy unhappiness. You don’t appear to be too positive since you only focus on the negative parts of your life.
Based on all these, your actions should be straightforward.

Indeed, you’re going through a dark period, but you have to acknowledge it and move on. Nothing will ever change if you don’t do anything. Acknowledging all these is the first step in the healing process. Once you learn how to do it, things will only get better.
Meaning of Reversed Five of Cups
When the Five of Cups is reversed, it indicates recovery. Again, it’s more of a mental approach. It’s not about recovery after an injury but recovery after regret and sadness.
You start to see some improvements based on your actions, so you finally appreciate the future you might be able to build.

With time, you’ll also understand that this dark time was a lesson. You’ll definitely learn a few things, which you can use later on to prevent such problems. You’re stronger and more resilient as well.
Reversed Five of Cups in Love & Relationships

In a love reading, the reversed Five of Cups tells you to stop living in the past. It won’t take you anywhere. The card is about moving on. You can suffer and be sad for a while, but it has to stop eventually.

If you’ve just been through a breakup, the card tells you to move on. Accept the past because you can’t change it anyway. A chapter has closed, so your life can start a new one. But without living in the present, you won’t be able to do it right.
Give yourself time, don’t force yourself.

If you’re in a relationship, the card symbolizes a tense time. You and your partner should sit down, leave your egos at the door, and have a solid conversation about how to improve the relationship. Dwelling on the past will only cause more suffering.
Reversed Five of Cups in Career
The reversed Five of Cups will help you recover. It’s a sign that your suffering will end soon and the same rule applies to your career as well. It makes no difference what kind of setback you had.

Maybe you lost a job, or your business died. The card tells you that you have the skills to continue and start all over. You can recover a few things from your losses, but you’ll have to build something new.
Healing is not an overnight process, especially given the amount of stress and pain you’ve been through. Give it time and work on it.
Reversed Five of Cups in Money

Been through financial issues? Struggling with money? The reversed Five of Cups is normally seen as a good sign. Your financial problems are about to reach to an end. Yes, you’ve lost some, but you’ve also learned some lessons.
Based on your current actions, you’ll be back to financial stability in no time.
Action is also required. Use what you’ve learned to grow. Use your leftovers for an investment, or maybe start a side gig. Anything works as you try to recover financially.
Reversed Five of Cups in Health

In a health context, you need to let go of pain. You must open up to a new approach in terms of well-being. It could be a new energy, a new technique, maybe a new diet. A new healing energy will give you the enthusiasm you need to overcome health issues.
Again, in most of these situations, the Five of Cups refers to the emotional side of your well-being.
Problems are now gone, and you can also start retrying for a pregnancy. If you’ve had some issues with the pregnancy, they’re about to fade away now.

If you ask how someone feels about you, you need to know that the respective person is ready to stop suffering. They’ve managed to realize that letting go of the past will put them back on track. No matter what disappointments they’ve been through, they’re ready to take the next step and move on.

Are you curious about their intentions toward you? The grief and sadness in their heart is no longer there. They intend to ignore the past, learn from their mistakes, and grow. The good news is they try to do it while on your side, so their intentions are good.

They see you as someone who has been through a lot in life. You’re seen as a strong individual who is ready for a new beginning. Your losses are seen as lessons, which is quite motivational for those around you.
What you need to do is turn your life around. Change your mindset, understand your sadness and move on, simple as that.
Numerological Meaning of Five of Cups
The Five of Cups is obviously associated with the number 5. It’s an upsetting energy, but with room to change.
When it comes to traditional numerology, the number 5 is all about communication.
Such energies are often mixed to boost your creativity and help you accept the past.
Astrological Meaning of Five of Cups
The number 5 is sometimes associated with Mars. Mars doesn’t always have good energy, as it could be upsetting at times. That’s what affects you at the moment.
At the same time, the number could also be associated with Mercury, offering a more creative approach to life.
Zodiac Correspondence of the Five of Cups

The Five of Cups is generally associated with Scorpio. The sign has numerous themes of intensity, especially at an emotional level. It’s a sign of transformation, but it also triggers a deep introspection.
Most of these energies are reflected in what the Five of Cups is trying to tell you if drawn in a reading.
Yes or No Meaning for the Five of Cups
The Five of Cups is hard to interpret in yes or no questions. However, given its interpretations, it leans towards a no.
In the reversed position, it’s a yes, as it shows signs of improvement. Things will change, but they require action from your side.
Key Actions
Be cautious and mindful when you see the Five of Cups upright. Take time to acknowledge and understand what you go through before moving on. Otherwise, your emotional wounds won’t heal.
If you see it reversed, it calls for work. It’s time to change. You’re healed, so stop focusing on the past and start building the future.​
In conclusion, Five of Cups is like a signpost that highlights the need to deal with your emotions, seize chances for change, and move towards a happier and more satisfying life path.

Home, childhood, innocence, nostalgia, all these things go hand in hand if you draw the Six of Cups. The card shows a couple of kids, six cups, and white flowers. It shows a bit of action, but also a safe environment due to the fort surrounding the kids.

To most people, the Six of Cups shows peace from within. Its interpretations, however, can be both positive and slightly negative. Which one suits you? Here’s everything you need to know while trying to determine the meaning of the card.
Meaning of Upright Six of Cups

The Six of Cups is usually associated with happiness and peace. Maybe it tells you that you’re in a bad place and you need to return to a peaceful time. Sure, memories are in the past, but this could also mean that those times are the only solution to regain your happiness.
While the Six of Cups shows how nice it was to have no worries whatsoever, it also tells you that you shouldn’t live in the past.

On another note, the upright card could also indicate your return to a familiar location. Maybe your hometown or even an old job. You’re definitely trying to reconnect with the past in one way or another.
Since it’s right after the Five of Cups, which suggests a loss, the Six of Cups could tell you that you’re trying to find an answer to current struggles by looking in the past.
Upright Six of Cups in Love & Relationships

The past is slowly coming back to life with this card. In a love reading, it tells you that you reconnect with old yet happy memories. You’ll appreciate your partner’s feelings for a family, but you may also reconnect with an ex-partner.
If you’ve had a tough time in the recent past, the card tells you that things are improving.
With all these, it’s important to avoid living in the past. Use it for good memories and lessons, but that’s pretty much it.
Upright Six of Cups in Career

In terms of career, take a look back and see what got you where you are today. The upright Six of Cups is trying to tell you that the past holds some valuable lessons which you could benefit from today. Otherwise, you’re likely to make mistakes again.
This isn’t just about doing things right but also about avoiding mistakes.

At the same time, based on your current position in life, the card could also tell you that you’re not 100% happy with your career right now. Perhaps you’re reconsidering it, or maybe you’re thinking of going back to a position from the past.
Upright Six of Cups in Money

The positive profile of the upright Six of Cups could also relate to your money. If you’re having a financial reading, the card could indicate a donation or maybe a gift. It could also relate to your ideas to share some of your fortune.
Given the association with the past and childhood, it could show a connection with family members.

For example, it could tell you that you’re going back to live with your parents, which will allow you to save more money. You could also be on the other side of wealth, going back to your hometown or welcoming family members over to share your wealth.
Upright Six of Cups in Health

In a health context, the card invites you to be charitable towards people in bad health condition. There are people out there who need more support than you can imagine. It could be someone you know, as well as a charity supporting people you don’t know.

The card may also tell you that you have a fast paced life. In the long run, it will become more and more stressful, leading to various illnesses. This means that simplifying life and going back to basics might be the best way to recover.
The upright Six of Cups is a good sign if you’re trying to conceive. It shows childhood and comfort, so it’s the perfect time to start a family or perhaps expand your current one.

If you need to know more about someone’s feelings, the card shows comfort. You’re that person’s comfort zone, so they feel good next to you. They can be themselves to 100%, and they’ll never hesitate to share their thoughts or opinions.

Their intentions are authentic and natural. They don’t have anything to hide, so they’ll be completely honest with you. You add to their confidence as well, whether it’s someone at work or in your personal life.

They see you as a safe friend or partner. They know they have nothing to hide when they’re with you. They’re not ashamed or afraid to express themselves in a natural manner, so they see you as someone who they can count on.

When it comes to action, the upright Six of Cups tells you to learn from your past. Focus on the present, but apply your past experience to make it better. It also tells you to embrace your relationships (both personal and professional) with wisdom and warmth.
Meaning of Reversed Six of Cups

The reversed Six of Cups tells you that you’re clinging to experiences from your past. Sure, exploring memories is a good thing, but remaining there is a bad idea. The past is only a thorough guide for your future.
From a different point of view, the card may also tell you that you’re failing to meet your childhood goals. Instead of dreaming, you should just focus on finding ways to get there.
Reversed Six of Cups in Love & Relationships

The message is pretty much the same if you get the Six of Cups in a reversed position. Something from your past is holding you back. It could be an ex-partner or maybe a past relationship. You just can’t open up to anyone else.

It could be because you don’t imagine you’ll ever meet someone better than your ex-partner. There’s a reason why they’re no longer there. Forget about the good parts and try to see the bad parts as well. It could help you lose the past and focus on the future.
Such an attitude will prevent you from finding a new partner, but it’s also unfair to the other party if you’re already in a relationship.
Reversed Six of Cups in Career
The reversed Six of Cups shows that your work is stale. There’s no progress whatsoever. It’s frustrating, and it feels like you’re stuck. You need to find something more exciting.

Regarding comfort, the card may also show your willingness to leave this workplace and find something more comfortable. On the other hand, if this is your comfort zone, you may choose to stay there even if you don’t like it that much.
Generally speaking, when this card is in reverse, there’s definitely a lesson to learn. Avoid negativity in the workplace and try to learn from the past in order to build the future.
Reversed Six of Cups in Money

Reversed, the card shows that you’re ready to leave the comfort of your home. It’s time to move out of your parents’ home, leave your hometown, and so on. Financially, this is a sign of maturity. You’re there, so it’s time to manage your available funds, get disciplined, and grow.
Such a change implies getting out of your comfort zone, but it’s mandatory at some point in life.
Reversed Six of Cups in Health

The reversed Six of Cups shows health related issues. They won’t really affect you physically, but emotionally. Unless you’ve had an accident as a kid that traumatized you for life, most of these issues relate to unresolved issues from your childhood.
Seeking help from a professional could help you make a better choice.
If you’re trying to conceive, start, or enlarge your family with a baby, the reversed Six of Cups is a bad sign. It shows fertility problems, as well as problems with a potential pregnancy.
Worried about someone’s feelings for you? The respective person is clearly stuck in the past. Their nostalgia has gone too far. While the past is definitely comfortable, it can also prevent growing.
Such people would rather go back to where they were than find a solution.
Intentions aren’t negative, but you need to expect that person is ready to reject the future. They focus on the past, so if you’re trying to advance, they won’t necessarily join you in this venture.
Unsure how someone sees you? If you see the card, it tells you that you’re the one stuck in the past. They want to enjoy the present moment with you, but they can’t.

In terms of actions, forget about the past for now. You have to force yourself to see the future and work on it. The past is valuable, but never more important than the future, so you need to do a bit of work.
Numerological Meaning of Six of Cups

The Six of Cups is associated with the number 6. The number itself radiates joy and life. From this point of view, it could be associated with the energy of the sun. In classic numerology, the number 6 relates to love and joy.
The number 6 is also seen as the mother of all the other numbers because it brings families together.

Simply put, the number is gentle and loving, but also trustworthy. Someone with this number guiding their path should have a family or work in teaching, assistance or other similar domains. They have a natural urge to help and protect.
Astrological Meaning of Six of Cups
The Six of Cups has more astrological interpretations.

Generally speaking, it’s associated with water. However, its ruling element is the sun. The sun is associated with childhood and innocence. It’s about purity, which is exactly what the Six of Cups reveals, too.

At the same time, the Six of Wands could also relate to Venus, the planet of nurturing love. That’s why those seeing this card are sometimes considered natural protectors of life. They like to help and provide safety.
Zodiac Correspondence of the Six of Cups

Despite quite a few different associations in terms of planets and astrology, the Six of Cups is most commonly related to the zodiac sign of Scorpio. The sign can relate to numerous elements, like excitement and passion. It’s representative for those who live life to the fullest too.
However, despite all these, there has to be a mission.

Given the nature of the sign, it’s a fierce thing. Mixed with the natural need for care and safety related to the Six of Cups, this mix of energy shows someone who can succeed in life by learning from the past, but with small obstacles here and there.
Yes or No Meaning for the Six of Cups

The upright Six of Cups tends to be positive, so it’s often seen as a yes card. It tells you that the current situation is warm and familiar. You’re stable from an emotional point of view, and while you connect with the past, you’ll also enjoy meaningful memories in the present.
The reversed position leans towards a no. The current situation needs fresh planning. The past must be left behind.
In this position in a yes or no reading, the card advises you to forget about familiar ways to see things. Instead, you need to get out of your comfort zone for a while.
Key Actions

The upright Six of Cups tells you to pay attention to small things and find passion in small things. You’re told to engage in activities with friends and family, the types of activities that feel comfortable and natural.
You could go back to an old hobby, for instance.

When reversed, the card gives you a warning. You’re not going in the right direction, so you need to change the way you see life. Sit back and plan everything from scratch with a fresh perspective. That will put you in the right direction.

The Seven of Cups has more associations, mainly about making choices and using your imagination. It shows a man looking at seven pictures coming out of cups, showing the necessity to make a decision. Clouds are also part of the description, defining imagination.

Now, this could mean many things, and it’s obviously related to an important choice. Which way are you supposed to go? Let’s go through all the possible interpretations of the card to help you navigate your options.
Meaning of Upright Seven of Cups

Upright, the card tells you to clarify your mind and imagination. Be careful with what you wish, but also pay attention to your possible choices. You could be seen as a dreamer, but at the same time, the card may also show the necessity of wishes and dreams.

Generally speaking, the upright Seven of Cups tells you to evaluate the pros and cons before making a choice. Caution is mandatory. While there are lots of opportunities out there, there are also some bad outcomes.
Upright Seven of Cups in Love & Relationships

If you’re not in a relationship, you may have to choose between more potential partners. Or maybe you’re stuck between a partner and your family. The card also means some choices may look appealing, but as you analyze them, you realize they’re nothing but illusions.
In a relationship, you have to consider your options before making a decision. In general, your instincts won’t be wrong at this time. Match them to a deep analysis, and you should have an answer.
Upright Seven of Cups in Career

You have more options to choose from in your career as well. Perhaps you’re advancing, but there are more ways to do it. It’s normally a good idea, but it’s important to find the best way. Also, you need to stop dreaming and make it happen.
The card tells you that no matter how many opportunities you have, nothing is going to happen if you don’t make any steps in that direction.
Upright Seven of Cups in Money

Financially, you can get better in more ways. But then again, sit down and consider each of them, as well as its advantages and disadvantages. While this card indicates many opportunities, it doesn’t always mean that you can decide on everything.
To make them real, you have to be super active in pursuing them. Be critical about each option and use your instincts as well. Potential red flags should push you in a different direction.
Upright Seven of Cups in Health

The upright Seven of Cups isn’t as positive when it comes to your health and well-being. Again, there are more things to consider, but the bad news is you do everything rather than focusing on one thing or another.
The card tells you that you’re about to get exhausted anytime soon. Doing too much at once will run you down and expose you to potential injuries.
Try to keep your workload under control and make sure you have some rest between tasks.
While not very common, the card could indicate hallucinations, which often relate to mental health issues.
The Seven of Cups isn’t the best card for a pregnancy. However, in some problematic cases, it may show an unwanted pregnancy. But if you’re trying to conceive, this isn’t really the best time.

Not sure how someone feels about you? That person sees you as an option. They need to decide on something. It’s not necessarily about love, but it could be something else as well. They have to consider their options very carefully.

Intentions are based on decisions. That person is likely to be very decisive, so expect a radical choice anytime soon. For example, they’re not sure whether you’re a potential partner or you should be in the friend zone.
The same rule applies if you want to understand how they see you. That person isn’t fully aware of the role you play in their life, so they don’t want to rush.
For actions, the upright Seven of Cups advises you to make a decision, but not without analyzing each possible option.
Meaning of Reversed Seven of Cups

When reversed, the Seven of Cups has similar interpretations. They’re also about dreams, options, illusions, and decisions. However, it tends to go in a more negative direction, meaning you’re more likely to focus on fantasies rather than reality.
The reversed Seven of Cups also indicates your lack of capability when it comes to dealing with the harsh reality of life. Daydreaming won’t get you anywhere.
From a more positive point of view, it shows the end of a confusing time.
Reversed Seven of Cups in Love & Relationships

Having no clarity whatsoever means your love life is a bit chaotic at the moment. You’re wasting both time and opportunities. You can’t make a decision, hoping time will fix it. It’s not going to happen, though.

This time of your life is filled with disappointments, confusing messages, and broken hearts. To get out of it, you need to concentrate on what you need. Taking action will also bring in some rewards.
Again, time won’t fix anything, so it’s up to you to make some decisions.
Reversed Seven of Cups in Career

If the upright Seven of Cups gives you lots of options to choose from, the reversed position means there aren’t any. You’re probably stuck in your current career and can’t advance because there are no opportunities.
You may also see some opportunities that have passed. There’s not much you can do about them now.
No matter where you are in your career, ditch the negative thoughts and try to get a clear vision. Focus on some new goals and make steps in that direction. It’s the only way forward.
Reversed Seven of Cups in Money
The financial interpretation may vary based on your unique circumstances.

Positively, the reversed Seven of Cups shows clarity. You’re making good financial decisions and you’re moving towards your objectives. You can’t be distracted and everything seems to be on track with your spending habits.
On the other hand, the card also shows confusion. It shows the incapability to turn your dreams into actual plans.
If you see opportunities, try to understand them first, or you could lose money.
Reversed Seven of Cups in Health

Your health isn’t in the best possible position due to a series of poor decisions. Maybe you’ve been working too much. Or maybe you prefer fast food because it’s quicker. Alcohol and drinks could also be indicated.
No matter what the issue is, the card tells you to regain control over your life. It’s difficult, and it may require professional help, but it’s doable.
The reversed position isn’t a good suggestion for a pregnancy, either. If you’re thinking of starting a family, it may not be the best idea to do it now.

If you need to know how someone feels about you, you should know they’re undecided. They have no clarity whatsoever, so they could miss out on opportunities. They might be able to make a decision at some point, but it could be too late.
They’re overwhelmed, so while they do want to do something good with their life, they might fail. Their intentions are good. They like the options they have, but they could do something stupid.
You’re seen as a choice at the moment. Even if you’re the perfect option for someone, they may not be able to see you because of the lack of clarity.
When it comes to action, you need to make a decision. Once you decide, it’s time to act on it. Stay grounded and make sure you’re realistic about your goals or you’ll end up daydreaming again.
Numerological Meaning of Seven of Cups

The Seven of Cups could have more associations in numerology. It could be about passion and excitement, but in traditional numerology, it’s mostly about dreams and visions. It sounds great, but your responsibility is to figure out how to ground them.
Similar to the upright and reversed interpretation of the card, numerology also tells you that there are many temptations and options around you.
You’ll find yourself in endless quests. As you keep digging, you may realize that your dream can’t really become reality.
Keep in mind that cups could also relate to emotions. If you want something big to happen, you might be disappointed.
Astrological Meaning of Seven of Cups
The Seven of Cups is normally associated with two planets.
First, it’s commonly related to Venus. Venus is seen as a feminine planet with feminine energies. It’s an exciting planet, but most of it refers to passion.
On the other hand, the Seven of Cups could also match the energy of Neptune.

If Venus is about dreams, ideas and visions, Neptune is more realistic. It doesn’t mean you’re one or the other. Instead, it means you need to assess your options, be objective about them, identify their pros and cons and make sure your dreams can actually become reality.

All these energies can be combined in different proportions for different people. While some people daydream all day long, some others will be more realistic. It’s up to you to determine which one you are based on your circumstances.
Zodiac Correspondence of the Seven of Cups

The Seven of Cups relates to the element of water. This means the association with Venus is more intense than the association with Neptune. Furthermore, the card also relates to the third decan of the zodiac sign Scorpio.
Now, Scorpio is ruled by Mars, leading to some conflicts.

Despite the powers of charm associated with Venus, Mars is more intense in terms of battles. There’s definitely a tension there. There’s desire, but then, there’s also the reality. They don’t match, hence the confusion.
The good news is someone in the zodiac sign of Scorpio is usually a doer, so things should go in the right direction eventually.
Yes or No Meaning for the Seven of Cups

The Seven of Cups is one of the most confusing cards in the tarot. While no card is 100% clear, this one takes issues to another level. It’s hard to determine whether it’s a yes or no. It could be a maybe. What truly matters is the necessity of more information. Only then you can reach to a proper conclusion.
The same level of confusion applies to the reversed position.

However, the reversed Seven of Cups recommends a cautious no. The card tells you that there’s simply too much confusion around you. You just cannot make a decision in this state, so you need to dig through your emotions and feelings first.
Key Actions for the Seven of Cups

How about actions? The upright Seven of Cups tells you to step back for a moment and evaluate your options before making rushed decisions. Otherwise, you risk prioritizing things that mean nothing, all these while real opportunities fly by.
You are encouraged to be realistic and ensure your decisions aren’t based on dreams. Just be mindful and keep your expectations grounded in reality.

Similarly, if you find this card in the reversed position, you’ll have to focus on clarity. You’re confused, especially from an emotional point of view. You’ll make poor decisions if you don’t clarify everything upfront.
Don’t be afraid to ask for help, find guidance, or even set some boundaries.

You don’t have to make any rushed decisions, yet opportunities could fly by if you take too much time. So, while it’s important to gain clarity in your life, you shouldn’t take ages to get there, but make a few steps in that direction. The further you go, the more clarity you’ll gain in the respective aspects of life.

In summary, when dealing with the choices and dreams shown in the Seven of Cups card, it’s important to think clearly and be careful when making decisions. This card reminds us to think before choosing, whether it’s upright or reversed.

The Eight of Cups often defines transition. We observe someone in a cloak leaving some cups behind, only to settle into a new place. This means you’ll leave certain things behind in order to find a new beginning.
Is it a good transition? A negative one? There are more ways to interpret this card. Let’s find out what each possible interpretation means based on the position of the card or the type of reading.
Meaning of Upright Eight of Cups

The upright Eight of Cups signifies a major change in life. Many times, this is related to leaving your comfort zone in order to grow. People have to do it every now and then in their lives, especially when feeling tired with their lifestyles.

Getting this card in an upright position shows unhappiness. You’re no longer satisfied with the direction of your life, so you need to seek a different lifestyle. This is when exhaustion kicks in, the final step before going towards a new life.
It sounds like a negative thing, but it’s actually a necessity.
Upright Eight of Cups in Love & Relationships

If you’re in a relationship, maybe it’s time to sit back and analyze it. Is this what you’re looking for? The upright Eight of Cups tries to tell you that you don’t fit perfectly in this relationship. If you can’t see yourself spending the rest of your life with this person, it might be time to move on.
People often get stuck in relationships because they don’t want to leave their comfort zones, which is unfair.
You need to be perfectly honest with yourself and make the right move.
If you’re single, maybe it’s time to get out a little and rejoin the dating scene.
Upright Eight of Cups in Career

Leaving something behind in your career may have multiple meanings. Sure, you could be leaving a stressful job. Maybe you’re sick and tired of your unfulfilling job, so you’re interested in a new opportunity.
But at the same time, if you’re alright with your job, it could also be a matter of taking a holiday. Maybe you just need to go away for a few weeks.
If you’re not sure about your job, there are times when you may have to cut your losses. You need to analyze all the factors associated with your job upfront.
Upright Eight of Cups in Money

Your finances may go in the same direction. Sometimes, you need to leave your work behind in order to grow. From this point of view, you may have to ditch financial security in order to build something greater, with even more rewards in the long run.
You shouldn’t make any decisions before analyzing everything upfront. Be cautious and make sure you don’t spend on things you don’t need.
With these thoughts in mind, the upright Eight of Cups could also be seen as a warning.
Upright Eight of Cups in Health

When it comes to your health, the upright Eight of Cups tells you that you focus on the wrong things. You’re dwelling on bad things in life, which will obviously affect your well-being as well. The idea is to change your mindset a little.
As you learn to prioritize, your health will become more important, so you’ll clearly notice some improvements.
With these ideas in mind, even a holiday could reset you.
The Eight of Cups is not necessarily a card about pregnancy but about change. This could also mean a pregnancy is on its way, even if it’s not planned.

If you’re not sure how someone feels about you, the upright Eight of Cups tells you that they’re questioning your connection at the moment. They don’t know if they’ll be happy with you in the long run, so their decision may go in any direction.
Their intentions are doubtful, too. The card shows they raise doubts about how you two connect. That person isn’t 100% sure if you’re the right person and may walk away.
They see you as someone who they may let go, only for them to grow. There are simply too many questions causing confusion.
As for what you should do, the upright Eight of Cups may indicate the necessity to move on. You may even have to leave something comfortable behind, but that’s how you move forward.
Meaning of Reversed Eight of Cups

The reversed Eight of Cups may or may not indicate the need to move on. In other words, it’s a confusing card. You’re confused because you’re not sure what’s best for you, and you don’t want to let go of the past.

Apart from feeling confused, you may feel aimless as well. The issue is caused by your incapacity to set some straight goals in life. A deep analysis of your life should put you back on track and show you the right way.
Reversed Eight of Cups in Love & Relationships

In love and relationship, the reversed Eight of Cups tells you that you should move on, yet there’s something holding you back. Indeed, it’s hard to leave something you’ve worked on, not to mention the emotions, feelings, and time invested.
But then, there are times when you just have to move on, especially if it doesn’t seem to work in the long run.
Give yourself time to clear the fog, and you’ll be able to make your own decisions accordingly.
Reversed Eight of Cups in Career

Deep down inside you, you know that your career isn’t going in the right direction, yet you find it hard to move on. You know that there’s not much you can change. You accept things for no reason. It doesn’t trigger your creativity, and it doesn’t give you the option to grow.
Despite the confusion, it’s important to analyze the situation objectively. The same rule applies to those who run a business. Sometimes, it’s wiser to cut your losses and let go.
Reversed Eight of Cups in Money

The upright Eight of Cups tells you to leave financial security behind for better rewards. The reversed alternative tells you it’s hard to do it. Maybe you’re in a job that gives you security, but you know it doesn’t make you happy.
To make the best decision, you have to consider your own happiness and determine how much it’s worth. Maybe start a new savings account to help you if you do decide to move on.
Reversed Eight of Cups in Health

The reversed Eight of Cups tells you that you’re doing something wrong. You do have the power to change it, but somehow, you decide to keep yourself in the respective situation. The impact on your health is significant.
It could be about joining a gym or changing a diet. Sure, it might be a bit stressful, but it’s the only way to improve your health at the moment.

The reversed Eight of Cups isn’t associated with a pregnancy either. However, if this is what the reading is about, it could indicate negativity, such as a difficult pregnancy. Ideally, you should avoid conceiving at this time.

If you want to know someone’s feelings for you, they fear to leave you. They want to do it, but they don’t know what’s going to happen after. Something is definitely holding them back. Eventually, they may go for it.

Their intentions are similar. They feel like they no longer belong there, so they try to release themselves from a trap, but they’re afraid to do it. It’s not what you want to hear, but that’s the situation at the moment.
People see you as someone who can make decisions for them. Your relationship isn’t great, but you’re in a comfort zone. They know things aren’t going the right way, though.

As for what you should do, sit down and analyze everything. The card is about confusion. Sometimes, it might be better to move on. Other times, it might be wiser to stay. You’re the only one who can make this decision though.
Numerological Meaning of Eight of Cups

Associated with the number 8, the Eight of Cups relates to wanderlust. But when it comes to traditional numerology, it relates to a series of positive elements, such as Infinity, balance, Fluidity and inspiration.
The number 8 also relates to perception and sustainability, as well as success and good intentions.
You are normally guided to step back and assess your situation and motivation. Sometimes, this destruction could make room for something better and stronger. But other times, it could be senseless.

The number 8 also signifies courage and action because to a lot of people, that’s what it means. It could also be negative if the card is reversed and may relate to weakness or even a consistent abuse of power.
Astrological Meaning of Eight of Cups
In astrology, the Eight of Cups has a few different associations.
For example, it has a good connection with Mercury and its wanderlust. But on the other hand, it can relate to Saturn as well. Saturn has a self destructive nature.

The energy you release is deep and masculine. From many points of view, the interpretation isn’t necessarily about you but also about those around you. In other words, you could be seen as a toxic person.
Zodiac Correspondence of the Eight of Cups

The Eight of Cups is defined by the water element, meaning it’s associated with water based zodiac signs. It’s most commonly interpreted as Pisces, since it’s in the first decan of the sign. Pisces relates to Saturn as well.
Now, from some point of view, this theme is about being mature. Saturn is a mature association, while the Pisces zodiac sign defines rediscovering self in order to find a deeper meaning to life.
The two associations have numerous limits and boundaries when mixed.
In some modern interpretations, the Eight of Cups can also be associated with Leo, which is ruled by the sun. In this particular case, the energy is fiery and more intense.
Yes or No Meaning for the Eight of Cups
Asking a yes or no question? If the Eight of Cups is drawn in an upright position, it indicates a no.
Based on the above interpretations, it may indicate the beginning of something new, something that will help you grow. But then, there’s a risk.

The new beginning could also come after a significant loss. The Eight of Cups also indicates abandonment. It’s a change that will ruin your comfort zone, so something may end in your life. With this aspect in mind, you should also be cautious and get ready to experience sadness.

In a reversed position, the card is a solid yes. Indeed, it’s a foggy situation that you’re not 100% sure about, but the card is encouraging to go for it, as the fog will clear up. You just need to make the first few steps and the darkness will disappear.
At this point, it’s just as important to follow your intuition and heart.
Key Actions

The Eight of Cups is an encouraging card, but not before assessing your situation. Step back, think about what makes you happy and what makes you unhappy. When you have all the details, you’ll be able to leave emotional baggage behind with no issues whatsoever.
It’s not necessarily about emotions and feelings, but also about other situations, such as work.

Whether in an upright or reversed position, you’ll need to honestly assess your life and situation. Like everyone else, you’re probably trying to get better and grow, but you won’t be able to do it based on luck only.

Even if this means writing down the pros and cons of a situation, it’s still better than diving in blindly. And if you’re not convinced, don’t do it. The card is about change and confusion, but it doesn’t mean it’s always a yes card. Sometimes, you’ll just have to stay where you are.

Bottom line, by looking closely at your situation and setting clear goals, you can work through this confusion and find your path again. Remember, this uncertain time can lead to deep thinking and, eventually, clarity in your journey.

The Nine of Cups shows an elegant man with a satisfied look on his face. He sits down on a bench and shows an active mind. The nine cups behind him are well organized, showing fulfillment in all fields of life. As you see it this way, the Nine of Cups looks like a successful card.

Despite the positive associations with it, the Nine of Cups could also be seen negatively, but it depends on the position. Based on the type of reading you have, here are all the possible interpretations of the card.
Meaning of Upright Nine of Cups

The Nine of Cups shows a long journey with all kinds of obstacles. But this journey is over. You’re satisfied with how you’ve pursued it, not to mention the final outcome. No matter what you’ve been through, you’ve managed to find purpose and find your goals.
You’re at a moment in life when you can actually celebrate your achievements. With these thoughts in mind, the upright Nine of Cups shows happiness.
Upright Nine of Cups in Love & Relationships

If you draw the upright Nine of Cups in a love and relationship reading, you should just appreciate where you are. Whatever you plan, chances are it will be there in no time. You have many reasons to celebrate as well.
If you don’t have a partner, feel free to go out. Hang out with friends, and you’ll find the one you’re looking for straight away.
On the other hand, if you already have a partner, this is the perfect time to celebrate your relationship. Despite a few hiccups in the past, it’s going well at the moment, so enjoy it.
Upright Nine of Cups in Career

For your career, the upright Nine of Cups tells you that you’re finally able to find respect and appreciation for your hard work. No matter what projects you’re involved in, they’re nearly done, so get ready to reap the rewards.
Your manager will show you praise. Your colleagues will appreciate you and follow you. Those in higher positions will be more receptive when it comes to your demands or requests.
It won’t last forever, so feel free to take advantage of it. You’ve earned this recognition.
Upright Nine of Cups in Money
The upright Nine of Cups tells you that what you’ve planned for worked well. The same rule applies to your finances. You’ve worked hard with some goals in mind. You can now enjoy everything you have.

The card is often associated with fortune, as well as financial security. Rewards will pop up one after another, so take the time to celebrate. After all, it wasn’t pure luck, but you worked for it. You deserve it.
Upright Nine of Cups in Health
In a health context, the card is also a good sign. If you’ve had certain health problems in the past, you’ll see them going away. You’ll feel better and more positive.

If you haven’t had any issues, the card shows you that there’s nothing to worry about in the future. At this point, there’s not much you can do but just pamper yourself a little. Get a massage, go to a spa, have some “me time” and enjoy it.

All these celebrations are a good sign if you’re trying to conceive. You’re in a relationship, and it’s in a good place, so you might as well try to have a baby. If it was one of your plans, this is the perfect moment to go for it. It will be just another reason to celebrate.

If you need to know how someone feels about you, that person feels safe close to you. They feel loved, and they love being by your side, whether personally or professionally. You are one of their goals in life.
Their intentions are positive too, since they aim to stay close to you and keep you in their life. They are grateful that you’re there and they feel like you two complete each other.
They genuinely respect and appreciate you. How they feel about you should give you even more reasons to celebrate because they’re happy.
As for action, you need to celebrate. Focus on yourself. You’ve worked hard, and you need some peace. Enjoy the rewards and make yourself feel even better.
Meaning of Reversed Nine of Cups

The reversed Nine of Cups asks you to think very carefully about your goals. While you’re in a relatively successful position, it also tells you that you’re looking for more fulfillment. In other words, your happiness is not 100% authentic.

It may feel like you’re in the wrong place, and you feel incomplete. You need something else and that hinders your satisfaction. From many points of view, the reversed Nine of Cups is about quality of life, rather than what you have.
Reversed Nine of Cups in Love & Relationships

In love, it feels like your relationship is great. Everyone sees it with good eyes, but you’re missing something. Maybe the past months have been dull. Maybe the passion is gone. Perhaps you want a deeper connection.
You can usually sort this issue out with communication.

If you’re single, love isn’t what you’re after right now. The card tells you that you’re trying too hard. Instead, there’s something else that should be a priority, and it’s different from love and romance. Sort this issue first, and love will come naturally.
Reversed Nine of Cups in Career

For your career, the reversed Nine of Cups is about wishes. You’ve been dreaming about something in particular. You’ve managed to get it, but it’s far from your expectations. It could be a new business, project, or position.
A lack of financial rewards could also be observed, depending on your circumstances.
What this means is you should go back to the basics, plan everything again, and see what you’ve missed on the way.
Reversed Nine of Cups in Money

A similar message is sent if you’re getting a financial reading too. You’ve worked hard to reach your goals, but your expectations are far from reality. No matter what you put your money in, the results were terrible.
Even if you’re helping someone or making an investment, the results will be disappointing.
The reversed Nine of Cups could also indicate the lack of stability. At this point, you need to be patient and keep working. It’s the only way to move forward.
Reversed Nine of Cups in Health

In a health reading, the card shows an eating problem. It could be bulimia, excessive eating, anorexia, a severe addiction, you name it. You’ll struggle to fix it yourself, so you’ll need professional help. Evaluate your condition from an objective point of view.
The card also tells you that negativity takes over in terms of health. You practically focus on the wrong things.

In a pregnancy, it’s not a good card. If you’re trying to conceive, expectations will be different from what you imagine. You’ll work hard with no results. And if you do manage to conceive, it will be a difficult pregnancy.

How someone feels about you should give you something to think about. You’re a good partner (whether personally or professionally), but you’re not completing that person. Something’s missing, and you need to figure out what.
Intentions could go in any direction. Despite feeling a connection with you, that person may start looking for what’s missing and that could lead to a separation.

They see you floating away despite the solid relationship you had in the past. It’s not always something major. Maybe both you and that person are too busy with your careers, so you’ve both overlooked your love life.
In terms of actions, chill down. Sit back and relax. Reassess your position in life and start with a new plan.
Numerological Meaning of Nine of Cups

The Nine of Cups is obviously associated with the number 9. Like other nines in the tarot deck, this card relates to a transition. It tells you that you’re close to the end of a cycle. It’s about attainment and some sort of success in various forms.

When you pull a card relating to the number 9, the cycle should be over soon. You can reap some rewards, but you also need to start planning for the next cycle. There’s another chapter starting in your life, and it requires proper planning.
In traditional numerology, the number 9 implies learning from the past and using these lessons in the future. It’s also associated with maturity through expansion and growth.
Astrological Meaning of Nine of Cups
The Nine of Cups can be associated with a few different planets, yet many interpretations refer to Neptune.

Neptune affects your subconscious mind. It can work on your fantasies, imagination, and dreams. It’s also responsible for inflicting beliefs and long-term plans. From some points of view, it’s a spiritual planet.

But despite all these associations, it could also be deceiving. Some of the fantasies you’ll develop won’t be real. There is, indeed, a huge potential for achievement, but confusion and deception could also arise when least expected.
Given these interpretations, Neptune has a major effect on your spiritual growth.
Apart from Neptune, another common association is with Jupiter.
Zodiac Correspondence of the Nine of Cups
The Nine of Cups has a solid connection with the element of water. It’s also associated with the second decan of Pisces.
Now, Pisces is ruled by Jupiter, which relates to power and leadership. It offers a great potential to grow, but only if you focus on meaningful things.

From a different point of view, the tides and other water elements in the world are ruled by the moon. Most of the human body also comprises water. Therefore, in this interpretation, the card could show a bit of confusion and illusion.
Yes or No Meaning for the Nine of Cups
The yes or no interpretation of the Nine of Cups depends on its position.
If it’s drawn in an upright position, there are no doubts about it. The Nine of Cups is a massive yes. No matter what the question is about, the card is super positive and pushes you from behind.

It tells you that you’re about to win in life. You’ll go through a series of celebrations. There’s not much you can do at this point, but just enjoy every second of it. You have many achievements coming soon, so get ready to experience one of the best times of your life.

The message is completely opposite if the Nine of Cups is drawn in a reversed position. It’s a solid no, no matter what you’re planning. The card is a warning at this point, telling you that you’re going down the wrong path. You’ll have to reassess your circumstances and find a different path for success.
Key Actions
One position of the Nine of Cups tells you to enjoy the present. The other position tells you to rethink everything.

If you get it upright, you need to focus on yourself. You’ve already worked a lot, so it’s time to relax. Invest in yourself. Get a massage, go on holiday with your partner, focus on your emotions, and celebrate your success with your loved ones.
It’s a card of joy. It also invites you to follow your dreams even further, as there’s still room to advance.
If you get it reversed, you’re on the wrong path.
Whether you see it or not, this path won’t take you anywhere, so it’s a waste of time and resources.
Think about your goals again and redesign a new plan to tackle life. Make sure your goals coincide with your current circumstances. Otherwise, you won’t be able to move forward.​

In the end, the Nine of Cups is all about happiness and your life path. When upright, it signifies a sense of accomplishment and fulfillment after overcoming challenges. On the contrary, when reversed, it tells you to think about your goals and what truly makes you happy.
